nl.tue.geometrycore.util

Class DoubleUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tue.geometrycore.util.DoubleUtil

  • public class DoubleUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class with convenience methods for dealing with double values, in particular, focused on handling imprecision.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double EPS
      Default tolerance for imprecision.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DoubleUtil()

      Returns whether the absolute value between A and B is at most EPS.
      static boolean close(double A, double B, double eps)
      Returns whether the absolute value between A and B is at most the given eps value.
      static boolean inClosedInterval(double a, double x, double y)
      Checks whether a value lies in an closed interval.

      Returns whether a value lies in a closed interval for a given precision.

      Checks whether a value lies in an open interval.

      Returns the smallest solution of a*x^2 + b*x + c = 0 strictly greater than a given threshold value.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public static boolean close(double A,
                            double B)
        Returns whether the absolute value between A and B is at most EPS.
        Parameters:
        A - first value
        B - second value
        Returns:
        |A-B| <= DoubleUtil.EPS

      • close

        public static boolean close(double A,
                            double B,
                            double eps)
        Returns whether the absolute value between A and B is at most the given eps value.
        Parameters:
        A - first value
        B - second value
        eps - tolerance value
        Returns:
        |A-B| <= eps

      • clipValue

        public static double clipValue(double A,
                               double min,
                               double max)
        Ensures that value A lies in range [min,max].
        Parameters:
        A - Value to clip to range
        min - Lower bound of range
        max - Upper bound of range
        Returns:
        A if A in [min,max]; min if A < min; max if A > max

      • inClosedInterval

        public static boolean inClosedInterval(double a,
                                       double x,
                                       double y,
                                       double prec)
        Returns whether a value lies in a closed interval for a given precision. Assumes x <= y. Positive precision makes the check "enlarge" the interval, negative values shrink the interval.
        Parameters:
        a - value to check for
        x - lower value of interval
        y - upper value of interval
        prec - precision
        Returns:
        a in [x-prec,y+prec].

      • inClosedInterval

        public static boolean inClosedInterval(double a,
                                       double x,
                                       double y)
        Checks whether a value lies in an closed interval.
        Parameters:
        a - value to check for
        x - lower value of the interval
        y - upper value of the interval
        Returns:
        a in [x-EPS, y+EPS]

      • inOpenInterval

        public static boolean inOpenInterval(double a,
                                     double x,
                                     double y)
        Checks whether a value lies in an open interval.
        Parameters:
        a - value to check for
        x - lower value of the interval
        y - upper value of the interval
        Returns:
        a in (x+EPS, y-EPS)

      • inOpenInterval

        public static boolean inOpenInterval(double a,
                                     double x,
                                     double y,
                                     double prec)
        Returns whether a value lies in an open interval for a given precision. Assumes x <= y. Positive precision makes the check "enlarge" the interval, negative values shrink the interval.
        Parameters:
        a - value to check for
        x - lower value of interval
        y - upper value of interval
        prec - precision
        Returns:
        a in (x-prec,y+prec).

      • solveQuadraticEquation

        public static double[] solveQuadraticEquation(double a,
                                              double b,
                                              double c)
        Returns the solutions of a*x^2 + b*x + c = 0.
        Parameters:
        a - factor for quadratic term
        b - factor for linear term
        c - factor for constant term
        Returns:
        array with 0, 1, or 2 values for x that satisfy the equation, in increasing order

      • solveQuadraticEquationForSmallestPositive

        public static double solveQuadraticEquationForSmallestPositive(double a,
                                                               double b,
                                                               double c,
                                                               double threshold)
        Returns the smallest solution of a*x^2 + b*x + c = 0 strictly greater than a given threshold value.
        Parameters:
        a - factor for quadratic term
        b - factor for linear term
        c - factor for constant term
        threshold - threshold value
        Returns:
        the smallest positive solution; NaN if no positive solution exists
